text: Steven Mark Grossman (January 18, 1951August 13, 2020) was an American jazz fusion and hard bop saxophonist. Grossman was Wayne Shorter's replacement in Miles Davis' jazz-fusion band. Then, from 1971 to 1973, he was in Elvin Jones' band. Grossman died on August 13, 2020 in Glen Cove, New York from cardiac arrest, aged 69. ==References== Category:American jazz musicians Category:American saxophonists Category:American composers Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:1951 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Steve Grossman
